description: System-generated unique identifier for a KPI dashboard configuration.
User-facing title displayed for the dashboard in lists and headers.
Structured metadata (e.g., JSON) describing widgets, layout, filters, and data sources used by the dashboard; confirm with SME.
User account that created the dashboard record.
Date and time the dashboard was first created.
User account that last modified the dashboard.
Date and time of the most recent modification.
Sharing scope that controls who can access it (e.g., private, public, specific groups); confirm with SME.
Identifiers or names of groups granted access when shared by group; confirm with SME.
Permissions granted to viewers or groups, such as view-only or edit capabilities.
Indicator that the dashboard targets field technicians or technician workflows.
Primary responsible user or account for this dashboard, used for administration and default sharing.
Numeric sort order used to position the dashboard within menus or folders.
Controls whether the dashboard is shown to users or hidden from view.
Associated workgroup name used for organizing or limiting visibility; confirm with SME.
Configured display width for the dashboard canvas or grid; units depend on the UI framework; confirm with SME.
Short summary explaining the dashboardâ€™s purpose and key KPIs.
Reference to a linked attachment or document associated with the dashboard (e.g., file, URL); confirm with SME.
Detailed description text shown in the interface, possibly longer than the short description.
Indicator that the dashboard is enabled or optimized for mobile devices.
